section.title: Android debuggable attribute in the AndroidManifest.xml
section.para: If you develop Android applications you can debug them via Eclipse. To enable debugging an a real Android device you need to add the android:debuggable="true" flag to the application segment in your AndroidManifest.xml file. The ADT tooling sets this flag automatically for debug builds based on the constant DEBUG of the BuildConfig class. This class is automatically updated by the ADT.

section.title: Turn debugging on at runtime in Eclipse
section.para: The JVM requires that you start a Java program in Debug mode to debug it. Android allows you to turn debugging for a running application on at runtime via the Debug button in the Device view of the DDMS perspective as depicted in the following screenshot.
After turning debugging on in this view, the next time a Breakpoint is encountered Eclipse allows you to debug the process.
